page.title: 03A LIFETIME ON ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: {Reminiscences of a lady who has lived {all her life in a house on Ashdown {Forest. Chuck Hatch, a gateway to Ashdown Forest, was in the early part of this century a secluded little hamlet. In 1985 it is very different -traffic speeds through and aeroplanes roar overhead. Changes noted include:- 1. Erection of letter box in the reign of Edward VII. 2. Bus service started in 1929 and discontinued in 1930. 3. Water main laid in 1938 until then water was fetched from a spring. 4. Electricity arrived in 1946 5. Chuck Hatch House, part of which was a shop until 1920, was made into 3 houses in 1963. 6. Bread,milk and groceries were delivered regularly but now only milk is delivered every other day.
